frame.name: Imposing_obligation
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Duty</fen> is imposed on a <fen>Responsible_party</fen> according to a <fen>Principle</fen> which regulates how the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> should respond to a <fen>Situation</fen>. The <fen>Situation</fen> may be expressed metonymically by reference to an <fen>Obligator</fen>, whose action invokes the <fen>Principle</fen>. It is only rarely the case that the <fen>Principle</fen> and the <fen>Situation</fen>/<fen>Obligator</fen> are both expressed overtly.
<ex>They escaped total Soviet invasion and occupation only by entering into <fex name="Principle">a separate agreement</fex> <fex name="Principle">that</fex> <t>obligated</t> <fex name="Responsible_party">them</fex> <fex name="Duty">to military action against the retreating German armies</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="pri">The lease agreements</fex> <t>bound</t> <fex name="Responsible_party">them</fex> <fex name="Duty">to make rent payments to Homeowners Rescue</fex>.</ex>
<ex>It was also discovered that with out her knowledge, <fex name="Obligator">he</fex> had <t>committed</t> <fex name="Responsible_party">her</fex> <fex name="Duty">to a new TV series</fex> and he had already taken an advance on the money.</ex>
<ex><fex name="sit">The Generality's invitation to give a conference on the theme</fex> <t>obligated</t> <fex name="Responsible_party">me</fex> <fex name="Duty">to study Gaud√≠'s work even more</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Responsible_party
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
<ex>The winning bid <t>committed</t> <fex name="Responsible_party">her</fex> to paint an oil portrait for the high bidder.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duty
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
<ex>Had she really said the word which <t>pledged</t> her <fex name="Duty">to marry Horace Holmcroft in a fortnight</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Condition
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Condition</fen>s under which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Duty</fen> .</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> by the <fen>Obligator</fen> or the <fen>Situation</fen>.
<ex>The City Council <fex name="Time">then</fex> <t>obligated</t> themselves to have the sewers made ready and the streets leveled off without any additional cost to the Sisters.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
<ex><fex name="Place">At Dayton</fex>, the parties <t>obligated</t> themselves to respect and promote fulfillment of the annexes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obligator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Obligator</fen> is the person who imposes the <fen>Duty</fen> on the <fen>Responsible_party</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Obligator">She</fex> <t>pledged</t> him to pay her the money back.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Situation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that results in the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> being obligated to carry out the <fen>Duty</fen> in accordance with the <fen>Principle</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="sit">Admitting a genocide was occurring</fex> would have <t>obligated</t> them, based on their signing the December 1948 Convention on the repression of genocide, to do something about it. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Principle
FE.definition:
<def-root>A regulating idea (which may be instantiated as a document) that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is subject to.
<ex>And <fex name="Principle">no law</fex> <t>obligated</t> him to talk to the police, let alone the media</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Obligator</fen> hopes to bring about by imposing the obligation.
<ex>She <t>pledged</t> him to work on the project <fex name="pur">just to get him out of her hair</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any holistic description of the details of the action, either comparing to another event or describing the action in terms of characteristics of the <fen>Obligator</fen> that affect the action holistically.
<ex>You <t>committed</t> me to this <fex name="Manner">maliciously</fex> !</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event which brings about the obligation.
<ex>She did n't understand that she <t>obligated</t> me to stay <fex name="mea">by always getting in trouble</fex> .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: bind.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: impose a legal or contractual obligation on.

lexUnit.name: commit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pledge or bind to a course, policy, or use.

lexUnit.name: charge.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an obligation placed upon another.

lexUnit.name: oblige.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to require or constrain (someone to do something) by legal, moral, or physical means
